summary:
ummm this new avengers 4 concept art shows steve in the armor he dies in in the comics …. 

EDIT: yes, he does often have this...
caption:
ummm this new avengers 4 concept art shows steve in the armor he dies in in the comics ….

EDIT: yes, he does often have this suit in the comics, BUT, he’s never had it fully like this in the movies. this is symbolic, the movie makers are now beginning to show him in this outfit to symbolise that he will meet a similar fate to Steve in the comics.

reblog.comment:

summary: Hello. I didn’t deserve to be in the company of these lovely humans, but six days ago I got to meet both Tom H’s. I made...
caption: Hello. I didn’t deserve to be in the company of these lovely humans, but six days ago I got to meet both Tom H’s. I made Hiddleston laugh by calling him Reindeer Games and he called me Tony Stark. Holland didn’t really seem to know what to do with me. Can’t blame him.

summary:
So I saw this on twitter and it got me thinking
Thanos told Gamora her planet was thriving, when actually she is the last of her...
body:
Why Thanos’ motive is flawed..

So I saw this on twitter and it got me thinking

Thanos told Gamora her planet was thriving, when actually she is the last of her people. I don’t think its a reach to say that many planets suffer the same fate. Now lets divulge shall we?

Thanos believes he will restore the natural order and the balance of the universe which is why he destroyed half of it. In the conversation he has with Dr. Strange on Titan, he said that the genocide will be random, and hence, merciful.

HOWEVER, I think there is a pattern to it. The snap killed people whose lives meant a lot/the most to our heroes(Steve lost Bucky and Sam,Tony lost Peter, Rocket lost Groot, Okoye lost T’challa,etc etc) and this was probably the case with the rest of the universe as well. Children were orphaned, hence plunged into a life of desperation and crime. Parents lost their kids, people lost their loved ones, suicide rates must be through the roof.

Many people of great power and importance would have been lost. Kings, queens and presidents, all gone, and many governments would fall. With no one to go to for help, the universe would be in chaos.

When the dust finally settles, the ones that do survive, just like Gamora, would be filled with hatred. Having lost everyone they loved, they wouldn’t care about anything or anybody. Having been so accustomed to death and destruction that it would no longer faze them. They would murder, torture and destroy, to do whatever THEY believe is right. And you know what? That sounds an awful lot like Thanos himself.

So no Thanos, the sun will not set on a grateful universe, it will set on one filled with chaos. He is not restoring the natural order, he’s only creating mad titans like himself.

blog.name: nlhollow
blog.title: Atheist, asexual, asleep.
blog.description:
Languages and Cultures undergraduate with a knack for many things (like writing) and a lack of many others (like the time to write).
Often struck by writing ideas with no idea how to develop them.

As you may have noticed, I'm a Marvel-Loki fan. Here's a periodically updated List of Loki appearances in Marvel comics and films.

If you know of any new (and old) appearances of Loki -be they from comics, books etc- you can point them out,
I've enabled the "Ask me anything" thing and called it "Point out Loki-appearances".

summary: What my dash has been consisting of lately:
body:
What my dash has been consisting of lately:

- Tom Holland crashing Tom Hiddleston panel and hugging him from behind

- Tall Tom despairing at the discovery that Smol Tom isn’t really Spiderman from that same panel

- Fanarts of Peter Parker hugging Loki from said same panel

- Strings of pictures that show just how well Tom Hiddleston’s sweatshirt showed off his pecs from that very one panel

summary: I'm going to say what I want to say at the end of this post. So please take time to look at these. Especially if you...
body:
Marvel: Important

I’m going to say what I want to say at the end of this post. So please take time to look at these. Especially if you dislike/hate/blame him/and/or think he is a villain in some way.


.


.

.


.


.


.

.


.

.


How can anyone in this fandom think Tony Stark is a terrible person?? I really can’t wrap my head around it. When I first found out that some people thought Tony Stark was terrible, selfish, self-absorbed, ect…, lets just say I was left baffled and shocked. Plus, I only just recently discovered this. How can anyone think this?? I’m not saying Tony is perfect and innocent, I’m really not, but at least he tries his f***ing best to fix his mistakes.

Now, I love the other Avengers and marvel superheroes just as much as I love Tony Stark, I really do. But they blame Tony for stuff (some stuff that isn’t even his fault, yet Tony tries to fix the mistake), beat him up, threaten him, betray him, abandon him, etc. Yet, despite all that, Tony remains loyal to them. Cause they’re his friends/family. He protects them and defend them. Even when they turn on him.

Tony Stark is a good person. Despite all the torture he has been through, he keeps helping people. Saving people. He does his best to make the world a better place. If he really was terrible, selfish, self-absorbed (etc…), he wouldn’t bother saving/helping people. Tony Stark is a freaking good person!

There’s more I want to say, but I’m sure my point was made clear. And if this post didn’t change you Tony Stark haters’ minds just a little bit, that Tony is a good person, then that’s fine. Just (I know I’m a hypocrite when I say this), keep your negative opinions to yourself. How would you feel if some people were talking crap about someone you like and that someone was a good person?

One last thing I want to say. I apologize to anyone that I made uncomfortable with this little tangent of mine. I am sorry.

blog.description:
|Erica| She/Her(21)

Unhealthy obsessions r’ us.

Steve and Bucky are my babies and deserve better.

tags: dont take these boys away from each other again
let him and bucky live happily in retirement
summary: There’s no reason Steve Rogers has to die. I really hope they don’t kill him off in the next Avengers movie and he can just...
body: There’s no reason Steve Rogers has to die. I really hope they don’t kill him off in the next Avengers movie and he can just calmly pass the torch and go live somewhere in retirement with Bucky.

reblog.comment: There’s no reason Steve Rogers has to die. I really hope they don’t kill him off in the next Avengers movie and he can just calmly pass the torch and go live somewhere in retirement with Bucky.

trail.content_raw: There’s no reason Steve Rogers has to die. I really hope they don’t kill him off in the next Avengers movie and he can just calmly pass the torch and go live somewhere in retirement with Bucky.
trail.content: There’s no reason Steve Rogers has to die. I really hope they don’t kill him off in the next Avengers movie and he can just calmly pass the torch and go live somewhere in retirement with Bucky.
